alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Bryan; Coal; Johnston; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 9:01AM CDT until June 12 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN JOHNSTON...NORTHWESTERN BRYAN...SOUTHERN COAL... NORTHEASTERN MARSHALL AND SOUTHWESTERN ATOKA COUNTIES... At 900 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Olney to near Kenefic to near Lake Texoma, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Kingston, Wapanucka, Lehigh, Silo, Milburn, Kenefic, Mead, Clarita, Olney, Fillmore, Woodville, Coleman, Little City, Nida, northeastern Lake Texoma, Phillips, Mcbride, and Boggy Depot Park. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
